page.title: 08Farming on Beeley Moor
page.content: There are three small farms of under a hundred acres and two larger ones of three hundred acres. The Hipper valley farms are in Beeley Parish and one lies within the{Peak District National {Park.}The other farms are in Ashover parish. All are worked by members of the family. There is no grouse shooting on the moor as it is syndicated to some Docters who find it too expensive to operate. {LOCAL MARKETS:-}two main markets are used for buying and selling: Bakewell and Uttoxeter. The abattoir at Sheffield is used. {E.E.C. RULINGS:-}two farms have been affected by the E.E.C. ruling relating to the 10% cut in the milk production and therefore have had to diversify. Three farms benefit from the sheep subsidy.
